org.ipdr
Class ConnectionDynamic

java.lang.Object
  org.ipdr.ConnectionDynamic
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class ConnectionDynamic
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Encapsulation of a single connection from a session. Holds the socket, input and output streams, and any related information.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Summary
protected static int extraAlloc
          Amount to increase the pushback buffer beyond what is needed (to avoid repetitive small re-allocations).
protected  byte[] unreadBuf
          The pushback buffer (we can't use PushbackStream because it requires a single fixed allocation and we don't know in general how much pushback will be needed).
protected  int unreadPos
          The position within the pushback buffer from which the next byte will be read.

Field Detail

unreadBuf

protected byte[] unreadBuf
The pushback buffer (we can't use PushbackStream because it requires a single fixed allocation and we don't know in general how much pushback will be needed).

See Also:
unreadPos

unreadPos

protected int unreadPos
The position within the pushback buffer from which the next byte will be read. When the buffer is empty, pos is equal to buf.length; when the buffer is full, pos is equal to zero.

See Also:
unreadBuf

extraAlloc

protected static int extraAlloc
Amount to increase the pushback buffer beyond what is needed (to avoid repetitive small re-allocations).

See Also:
unreadBuf

makeListeningInstance

public static ConnectionDynamic makeListeningInstance(java.net.ServerSocket serverSocket,
                                                      CollectorConfigI collectorConfig)
                                               throws ConnectionIOException
Creates a new instance of ConnectionDynamic, which listens on the given server socket for incoming TCP connections The method throws an exception if no connection was made during AcceptTimeout seconds

Parameters:
serverSocket - - server socket to accept connections on
collectorConfig - - collector configuration
Returns:
ConnectionDynamic instance
Throws:
ConnectionIOException

close

public final void close()
                 throws ConnectionIOException
Close the socket connection and ensure everything is sent. (With the usual caveat about solinger and friends.)

Throws:
ConnectionIOException - If the close doesn't go properly.

setSoTimeout

protected final void setSoTimeout(int timeout)
                           throws java.net.SocketException
Set the socket timeout for read. This operates on a cached value, for efficiency (only calling socket.setSoTimeout when there's a changed).

Parameters:
timeout - miliseconds to wait before interrupting the read.
Throws:
java.net.SocketException - If it's not supported.
See Also:
getInputSynchronizer()

write

public void write(byte[] b)
           throws java.io.IOException
Write an array of bytes to the socket. If you want to write in multiple chunks (e.g., a header, then the body), you should use getInputSynchronizer()to ensure that another thread doesn't interfere.

Parameters:
b - The bytes.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the write fails.
See Also:
OutputStream.write(int), getOutputSynchronizer()

readFully

public final void readFully(byte[] b,
                            int off,
                            int len,
                            int timeout)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Read a specified number of bytes. See the general contract of the readFully method of DataInput. Bytes for this operation are read from the contained input stream. If you want to read in multiple chunks (e.g., a header, then the body), you should use getInputSynchronizer()to ensure that another thread doesn't interfere.

Parameters:
b - the buffer into which the data is read.
off - the start offset of the data.
len - the number of bytes to read.
timeout - timeout in milliseconds.
Throws:
java.io.EOFException - if this input stream reaches the end before reading all the bytes.
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
java.io.InterruptedIOException - if the timeout is exceeded; in this case the bytesTransferred vaule will have the number of bytes that were read into the buffer (b) before the exception. A value of zero should not be interpreted as meaning that nothing was read; the implementation of this method may choose to save the bytes in a separate (invisible) buffer.
See Also:
FilterInputStream.in, DataInput.readFully(byte[]), getInputSynchronizer()

unread

public final void unread(byte[] b,
                         int off,
                         int len)
Push back bytes to be read again. If you are reading in multiple chunks (e.g., a header, then the body), you should use getInputSynchronizer()to ensure that another thread doesn't interfere.

Parameters:
b - Bytes to push back.
off - Offset with b of the bytes to be pushed back.
len - Number of bytes to be pushed back.
See Also:
PushbackInputStream.unread(int), unreadBuf, unreadPos, extraAlloc, getInputSynchronizer()

read

protected int read(byte[] b,
                   int off,
                   int len)
            throws java.io.IOException
Read bytes from the input stream. If you want to read in multiple chunks (e.g., a header, then the body), you should use getInputSynchronizer()to ensure that another thread doesn't interfere.

Parameters:
b - array of bytes to be filled.
off - offset within the array to start filling.
len - maximum number of bytes to read.
Returns:
number of bytes actually read.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong (or a timeout).
See Also:
PushbackInputStream.read(), getInputSynchronizer()

getInputSynchronizer

public java.lang.Object getInputSynchronizer()
An object to use for synchronizing on inputs. This might be needed if you do an intial readFully(byte[], int, int, int)to get a header, followed by another readFully(byte[], int, int, int)to get the rest of the message.

Returns:
The synchronization object.

getOutputSynchronizer

public java.lang.Object getOutputSynchronizer()
An object to use for synchronizing on outputs.

Returns:
The synchronization object.

Get the address and port as a printable string.

Returns:
A string in the form "IPAddress:port"

getAddress

public java.net.InetAddress getAddress()
Get the ip address as an InetAddress object

Returns:
InetAddress or null if the socket is null

getPort

public int getPort()
Get the remote port

Returns:
remote port or 0 if the socket is null
